labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on project and issue management through the Linear platform, leveraging its API to perform operations such as creating, updating, and listing issues, as well as managing teams and projects. The tools available enable users to interact with Linear's ecosystem programmatically, making it a powerful tool for AI agents to enhance project management workflows. The core functionality revolves around team collaboration, task tracking, and workflow automation within a project management context.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Project Management" is chosen because the server's core tools and functionality align closely with managing projects and issues, which is the foundation of project management. The secondary label "Team Collaboration" is included because the tools allow for interaction with teams and projects, facilitating better teamwork. The secondary label "API Integration" is also relevant because the server operates through Linear's API, making it a tool for integrating project management functionalities programmatically. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality adequately.

server_info_crawled.name: Linear MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mikephul/linear-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage issues, projects, and teams programmatically through the Linear platform. Interact with Linear's API to create, update, and list issues and projects seamlessly. Enhance your AI agents with powerful tools for effective project management.

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Deploy Server Linear MCP Server @mikephul/linear-mcp Try in Playground create_issue

tools.name: list_teams
tools.description: List all teams in the workspace

tools.name: search_issues

tools.name: get_issue

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mikephul/linear-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: linearApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Linear API key with permissions to manage issues, teams, and projects.
